intro: Micranthes lyallii subsp. hultenii, commonly known as Hulten's micranthes, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and streamside areas. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its adaptability to high-altitude environments.
